name: LowIntensityStatinTherapyBranded
title: Low Intensity Statin Therapy/Branded
purpose: (Clinical Focus: The intent of this value set is to represent SBD and BPCK  low intensity statin medications as defined by the 2018 AHA/ACC/AACVPR/AAPA/ABC/ACPM/ADA/AGS/APhA/ASPC/NLA/PCNA Guideline on the Management of Blood Cholesterol.),(Data Element Scope: RxNorm SBD and BPCK low intensity statin medications as defined by the 2018 AHA/ACC/AACVPR/AAPA/ABC/ACPM/ADA/AGS/APhA/ASPC/NLA/PCNA Guideline on the Management of Blood Cholesterol. NOTE: The medications in this value set do not align with the low intensity statins present in 2.16.840.1.113762.1.4.1047.107, since that value set represents the 2013 ACC/AHA listing of low intensity medications.),(Inclusion Criteria: Semantic branded drugs (SBD) and semantic branded drug packs (BPCK) codes that represent low intensity statin medications defined by the 2018 AHA/ACC/AACVPR/AAPA/ABC/ACPM/ADA/AGS/APhA/ASPC/NLA/PCNA Guideline on the Management of Blood Cholesterol NOTE #1: Per the 2018 guidelines, Pitavastatin 1 mg is no longer considered a low intensity statin (i.e., Pitavastatin 1-4 mg is now considered a moderate intensity statin). NOTE #2: Liquid statin medications are included in this value set (e.g., Simvastatin 4 mg/ml and Simvastatin 8 mg/ml). Be aware that the quantity of milliliters is required to confirm that the patient is taking the equivalent of a low intensity statin versus a moderate intensity statin.),(Exclusion Criteria: Semantic clinical drugs (SCD) and semantic clinical drug packs (GPCK) RxNorm codes that represent low intensity statin medications, along with any RxNorm codes that represent high or moderate intensity statin medications.)
